channel.title: The Hodljuice Daily Pint
channel.itunes:author: curated by Hodljuice
channel.description: Daily collection of various Bitcoin-related podcasts

item.title: BTC Sessions : MAJOR Behind-the-Scenes Moves: Microsoft, Rumble, and Saylor! ep454
item.itunes:author: BTC Sessions
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin adoption, market movements, financial audits, crypto policy
item.description: This episode analyses crucial developments in the Bitcoin and finance sectors, such as the Pentagon's audit failures and Rumble's potential Bitcoin purchase influenced by Michael Saylor. MicroStrategy made its largest Bitcoin acquisition while Goldman Sachs bought $710 million in Bitcoin ETFs. The episode also touches on trends concerning Bitcoin's future in China and discussions between Coinbase's CEO and Donald Trump.

item.title: Bitcoin Optech : Bitcoin Optech: Newsletter #329 Recap
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Optech
item.itunes:keywords: Offchain payments, Bitcoin Core updates, software releases
item.description: Mark “Murch” Erhardt discusses recent developments in Bitcoin, including a new offchain payment resolution protocol and insights from two key papers on censorship of Lightning Network payments. The episode also reviews important code changes and the latest release candidates for notable Bitcoin projects, such as Bitcoin Core and BTCPay Server.

item.title: Bitcoin Optech : Bitcoin Optech: Newsletter #328 Recap
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Optech
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin vulnerability, software updates, Bitcoin Core reviews
item.description: In this episode, Mark “Murch” Erhardt and Gregory Sanders discuss a recently disclosed vulnerability affecting older Bitcoin Core versions and the latest news from the Bitcoin Core PR Review Club. The episode also highlights important software releases, like Bitcoin Core 27.2, and significant code changes within the Lightning Development Kit (LDK).

item.title: Bitcoin for PEACE : Bitcoin Even Without Internet: KG's Mission to Transform Africa
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for PEACE
item.itunes:keywords: Financial inclusion, technology innovation, Bitcoin adoption
item.description: This episode features KG, who is working to bring Bitcoin access to Africans without internet connectivity through his service Machankura. He discusses the potential impact of this innovation on communities with limited internet access and shares his personal journey in technology and music. The conversation also highlights broader themes of financial freedom and the transformative power of Bitcoin.

item.title: Bitcoin for PEACE : From Punk Rock to Venture Capital: Mike Jarmuz's Journey
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for PEACE
item.itunes:keywords: Venture capital, startup funding, personal journey
item.description: Mike Jarmuz shares his transition from punk rock to venture capital, focusing on his efforts to support startups in the Bitcoin space. Discussing his platform Thunderfunder, he explains how it aims to democratize investing for non-accredited investors. The episode highlights the parallels between music and venture capital, along with advice for founders and investors in this landscape.

item.title: Bitcoin for PEACE : Podcasting 2.0 Summit: Revolutionizing Content Creation with Adam Curry and Special Guests
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for PEACE
item.itunes:keywords: Podcasting innovation, community building, decentralized media
item.description: This episode captures insights from the Podcasting 2.0 Summit, where Adam Curry discusses new tools for empowering creators and creating revenue streams through innovative features. The conversation emphasizes the potential for decentralized media and the importance of community engagement among podcasters in this evolving landscape.

item.title: Blockware : Buy Bitcoin for $100,000. Mine Bitcoin for $40,000.
item.itunes:author: Blockware
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin price predictions, mining operations, investment strategies
item.description: In this discussion, Blockware's Head Analyst explores the implications of Bitcoin potentially hitting $100,000 for miners. Insights cover strategic responses for Bitcoin mining operations and the evolving investment landscape within the Bitcoin ecosystem, providing context for both novice and experienced miners.

item.title: PlebUnderGround : How a 30k Rugpull Becomes A 4 Million Dollar Loss?
item.itunes:author: PlebUnderGround
item.itunes:keywords: Crypto scams, rug pulls, community impact
item.description: The hosts cover a stunning rug pull executed by a 12-year-old that resulted in substantial losses for investors. Discussion centers on the prevalence of scams in the altcoin and memecoin markets, the background of the scammer, and the social media backlash their family faced.

item.title: Rabbit Hole Recap : BITCOIN $100K IN SIGHT | RABBIT HOLE RECAP #332
item.itunes:author: Rabbit Hole Recap
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin market trends, major announcements, economic implications
item.description: This episode discusses a range of Bitcoin-related developments, including the SEC chair's resignation and MicroStrategy's significant fundraising for Bitcoin purchases. The hosts evaluate reactions to new features in cryptocurrency applications and highlight the impact of internet censorship on Bitcoin accessibility.

item.title: Robin Seyr : USA's BIG Bitcoin MOVE 2025: Why EVERY NATION Will Follow!
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyr
item.itunes:keywords: Global finance, Bitcoin adoption, political influences
item.description: Robin Seyr and Neil Jacobs explore the transformative potential of Bitcoin amidst political changes and its rise as a global currency. The discussion focuses on the implications for businesses and individuals as Bitcoin becomes a recognized asset and the importance of community engagement in leveraging this financial revolution.

item.title: SimplyBitcoin : 5 Reasons Bitcoin Is About To ABSOLUTELY EXPLODE: Here's Why | EP 1124
item.itunes:author: SimplyBitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin price analysis, market trends, economic indicators
item.description: The hosts discuss the current Bitcoin pricing landscape, weighing whether the market is overheating or set for substantial growth. They highlight Bitcoin's fundamentals and the supporting economic indicators signaling an imminent increase in value, potentially reaching $100,000.

item.title: Stephan Livera Podcast : Debunking Climate Myths with Tom Nelson | SLP618
item.itunes:author: Stephan Livera Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Climate change discourse, media influence, Bitcoin's role
item.description: Tom Nelson discusses misconceptions about climate change, focusing on the narrative that carbon dioxide is the main culprit. The episode critiques alarmism in climate policies and explores how narratives shape public perception, including discussions on Bitcoin's role in countering misconceptions surrounding energy use and climate impact.

item.title: Swan Signal Live A Bitcoin Show : $100k Incoming! | Bitcoin Strategic Reserve | Trump Admin Picks | Microstrategy Miracle
item.itunes:author: Swan Signal Live A Bitcoin Show
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin price predictions, economic inequality, strategic investments
item.description: This episode features discussions on Bitcoin's potential to approach $100,000 and its broader economic implications. The hosts cover MicroStrategy's investment strategies under Michael Saylor and Bitcoin's role in addressing economic inequality in a changing financial landscape.

item.title: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast : #559: Death Throes of the European Cabal with Tom Luongo
item.itunes:author: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Political analysis, economic strategies, funding government
item.description: Marty and Tom Luongo discuss potential next steps following Trump's election victory, analyzing the political landscape and implications for U.S. foreign policy. The episode explores various strategies for government funding, including the impact of recent appointments and the current zeitgeist in politics.

item.title: The Bitcoin Layer : Bitcoin Nears $100,000: How High Can It Go?
item.itunes:author: The Bitcoin Layer
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin price surge, economic analysis, market dynamics
item.description: This episode features an analysis of Bitcoin nearing $100,000, exploring the factors driving this surge such as institutional demand and macroeconomic conditions. The host discusses Bitcoin's potential trajectory, evaluating the impact of upcoming economic policies and the vision for Bitcoin's value in the long term.

item.title: The Breakdown : A Crypto Czar in the White House?
item.itunes:author: The Breakdown
item.itunes:keywords: Crypto policy, political speculation, industry impact
item.description: This episode discusses the speculation surrounding the potential appointment of a "crypto czar" by the Trump administration, with significant implications for cryptocurrency policy. The conversation also includes Michael Saylor’s upcoming presentation to Microsoft, emphasizing the importance of these developments in shaping the future of crypto regulation.

item.title: The Mining Pod : ASIC Prices, Russia Restrictions, Alaska Bitcoin Mining, $4.6B Mining Stock Shorts, Bye Bye Gary
item.itunes:author: The Mining Pod
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin mining industry, market updates, regulatory impacts
item.description: The Mining Pod team discusses recent developments in the Bitcoin mining sector, including a rebound in ASIC prices, restrictions on mining in Russia, and innovative mining projects in Alaska. They also cover the impact of a $4.6 billion short position against miners and celebrate the resignation of Gary Gensler.

item.title: The What is Money Show : The Bitcoin Effect: Why does Bitcoin Radically Change People's Lives? with Robert Breedlove (WiM533)
item.itunes:author: The What is Money Show
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin philosophy, community values, personal transformation
item.description: Vivian Cheng chats with Robert Breedlove about the core values of Bitcoin and its life-changing effects on individuals. They discuss concepts such as time preference, the journey of accumulating Bitcoin, and the motivation required to persevere in challenging times, emphasizing the community's significance.
